responses.question: Tell me more about yourself and why you're interested in this field.
responses.answer:
Working in UpGrad’s EdTech environment required me to understand how sociocultural, economic, and technological factors influence learner engagement. A key project involved analyzing user behavior across different regions to improve engagement and accessibility.

Using SQL queries filtered by location and time zones, I extracted region-specific engagement metrics. My analysis revealed that Southeast Asian learners were most active in early mornings, while Indian learners showed peak activity in the evening. I proposed time-zone-optimized content releases and notification strategies. After implementation, an A/B test showed an 11% increase in module engagement in the experimental group.

In a separate analysis, I examined video buffering and dropout data. I found that learners from Tier-2 cities experienced 35% more buffering issues and 28% lower completion rates for HD content. I recommended implementing compressed videos and text-based content for low-bandwidth regions. These recommendations led to a 17% improvement in content accessibility.

This project demonstrated that effective engineering goes beyond technical solutions. By analyzing how regional infrastructure and digital literacy impact user experience, I was able to design data-driven interventions that improved both inclusivity and platform performance. This reinforced my understanding that real-world engineering requires constant consideration of contextual factors that affect how users interact with technology.
